title: Kelly Rowland promises to 'cut loose' when performing at The Everest horse race
text:
Kelly Rowland has promised to 'cut loose' during her performance at The Everest horse race at Sydney's Royal Randwick.

The former Destiny's Child star signed on to bring out her greatest hit's at the prestigious event on October 19.

When speaking about her upcoming performance, the singer said she has always enjoyed putting attitude into her act.

'If there is no naughtiness the show becomes dull!' On Friday, Kelly Rowland (pictured) promised to 'cut loose' when performing at The Everest horse race on October 19

'If there is no naughty or sassiness, the show just becomes really dull,' Kelly told The Saturday Telegraph on Friday.

Kelly said she had learnt a lot from her time at Destiny's Child and singing with sassiness was how she wanted to perform.

'When you perform, that is your freedom, that is your time where you just really get a chance to cut loose.'

Sing it! Kelly said she had learnt a lot from her time at Destiny's Child and singing with sassiness was how she wanted to perform

The star said she would be singing some of her own biggest hits on stage along with Say My Name from her days at Destiny's Child.

Kelly released an album in 2018 and promised the songs on stage would be a mix of old and new with a specialised outfit to bring it all together.

The singer previously announced, in a major win for NSW racing, that Kelly would be performing a free concert for all racegoers.

Corina Black, head of commercial for the Australian Turf Club, told the Herald Sun they were 'delighted to welcome Kelly to perform as the headline artist'.

Working it! The former Destiny's Child singer will hit the stage to perform a medley of her hits, including When Love Takes Over, Commander and Work

'Kelly is a bona fide international star who has a strong connection with her passionate Australian fans,' said Ms Black.

Earlier this year, rumours swirled that Kelly was preparing to leave her coaching role on The Voice Australia to focus on her family.

In May, she told TV Week she was eager to give her son Titan a sibling, saying: 'I am itching to have another child. It's really important to me!'

Kelly shares her five-year-old son with her husband, talent manager Tim Witherspoon.
description: Kelly Rowland has promised to 'cut loose' during her performance at The Everest horse race at Sydney's Royal Randwick.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
